definition: hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: Where? Wait a minute. I thought mammoths were extinct.
sentences.chinese: 在哪里呢？等等。我以为长毛象已经绝种了。

sentences.english: Because you might be the only two mammoths left on Earth.
sentences.chinese: 因为你们俩个可能是地球上唯一的两头长毛象。

sentences.english: Be that as it may, when's the last time you saw another mammoth?
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，你上一次见到别的长毛象是在什么时候？

sentences.english: Maybe mammoths are going extinct because they put themselves in danger too often.
sentences.chinese: 也许长毛象就是因为它们太爱冒险而会绝种的。

sentences.english: Giants balls of furry lava the size of mammoths raining from the sky.
sentences.chinese: 像长毛象般大的圆球形羽毛状熔岩将会从天而降。

sentences.english: I'm talking about you being the last of your kind.
sentences.chinese: 你在说，你是世界上的最后一头长毛象了。

sentences.english: Wildlife struggles, as the extinction of the Mammoth shows.
sentences.chinese: 就像远古长毛象显示的那样，野生动物会挣扎求生。

sentences.english: Gassy mammoths emitting methane helped to keep pre-historic Earth warm, scientists believe.
sentences.chinese: 科学家认为，史前长毛象喷出的沼气让地球变暖。

sentences.english: Garfield:And then I ate a woolly mammoth.
sentences.chinese: 然后我就吃了一头长毛象。

sentences.english: In Aichi expo. , the most important exhibition is Mammoth.
sentences.chinese: 这次的万国博览会最主要的展览物是长毛象。

definition: monstrous bird/moa (genus Dinornithidae, extinct bird of New Zealand)
